title: Russia SME Intern
content:
Job ID: 937
We're looking for someone to join the Media Manipulation Monitor (M3) team as we decipher complex information operations (IO) for discerning US government and Fortune 50 clients. M3 decodes the Chinese and Russian government’s manipulation of the global information space, and we need a Russia Subject Matter Expert (SME) to help our clients make sense of the Russian government’s IO within Russia and around the world.
What you’ll do
As a SME intern at M3, you will be responsible for curating and analyzing data about Russian IO while providing broader support to the SME team. You’ll bring knowledge of Russian domestic politics and foreign policy, professional proficiency in Russian, understanding of the Russian social media landscape, and an interest in data analytics. You'll work with M3’s team of SMEs to deliver analysis to our elite clients, applying your expertise to help solve some of the most important foreign policy questions facing the US Government today.
In this position, you’ll work with our team of SMEs to:

Use data analytics platforms and proprietary data science tools to identify and analyze anomalies, propaganda campaigns, and narratives about current events on social media platforms.
Interpret the Russian government’s foreign policy objectives in client-facing written analysis.
Curate lists of relevant social media accounts pertaining to Russian IO within Russia and around the world.
Work with our data scientists and engineers to refine and develop analytic tools, such as by using your language skills and regional expertise to label training data for our machine learning models.
Maintain M3’s customer-facing products, including our website and data platforms.
Embody analytic excellence and consistently challenge our team’s assumptions.

More about the role
At Two Six, we strive to solve problems collaboratively, innovate and respond to feedback. We always seek to include, thank, celebrate, and be kind to our team members. As a Russia SME intern, you will embody these values, working independently and with your team to tackle challenging problems with cutting-edge technology.

This is a paid, part-time internship position, lasting for six (6) months. The start date is flexible, though we are targeting mid November or early December.
We are looking for someone to work approximately 20 hours per week, with some flexibility about schedule, allowing for attendance at some team meetings and working around our production schedule.  
This position is fully remote, just like the rest of the M3 team. Our normal business hours tend to align with the East Coast, but we are flexible and we work with teammates and clients around the world.
You'll work with members of our Data Science, Engineering, and Product teams to iterate on and improve our collection, data analytics, and content production processes. 
That said, we do not expect our SMEs to be able to code. We train all SMEs in quantitative methods and AI/ML tools, and create space for them to hone their ability to work with complex technical systems. 
This role’s work is unclassified and no clearance is required, though all applicants must meet the requirements to hold a US security clearance.

What we’re looking for in a Russia SME Intern
Here are some of the skills and requirements you’ll need to dive into the role:

Strong writing skills, especially with crafting concise analytic summaries of data.
Professional reading proficiency (ILR 3 equivalent or higher) in Russian. 
Strong understanding of Russian foreign policy and domestic politics.
Strong understanding of Russia’s traditional and social media environment.
Demonstrated initiative and problem solving skills.
Great organization, attention to detail, ability to work independently and meet deadlines.
Proficiency in office technology, including Google Drive, Google Docs, Microsoft Office, and video call software.

Other nice-to-haves include: 
Members of our SME team have different expertise and come from a wide range of backgrounds. We’d love to hear what makes you uniquely able to serve our customers. Some of the qualities that might help you stand out include:

Broad, first-hand knowledge of Russian society, ideally stemming from experience living, working, and/or studying in Russia or another country of the former Soviet Union.
Experience researching or analyzing Russian media or Kremlin information operations in prior coursework, jobs, or internships. 
A passion for communicating findings visually with charts, graphics, and design.
Love of solving problems with data. This can include—but is not limited to—turning to Python or other programming languages to scrape, clean, and analyze data.
A “futurist” in analysis, with exposure to elasticsearch/ELK Stack, machine learning, or natural language processing.
Exposure to the US government and a passion for mission.
Experience collaborating with teams of diverse, cross-functional specialities and a love for integrating the best that each brings to the table.
